Problem 86. Let c > 0. Let A be a set of n (distinct) integers. Does there exist
θ such that no interval of length 1
n in R/Z contains more than nc of the numbers
θa(mod 1), a ∈A?
Comments. This is only known for c > 1
3; see [187]. The problem is raised as [209,
Problem 17 (4)], where it is attributed to Komlós and Ruzsa. This problem feels
not unrelated to questions like Problem 43, but I do not know a direct connection.
